file_content.text: Thanks for your help. It's nice to know the Republic and resistance can work together after all.
The long-range scanners are functioning again. Next time the Imperials try to launch a sneak attack, they'll be in for a shock!
I hate to admit it, but the resistance could never have done this alone. Our families are safe for another day because of you.
I can't change the past, but going forward, we have to work together to defeat the true enemy.
The Republic is on your side.
I sense you hold resentment for the Republic in your heart. Let it go.
Remember this in the future.
You Jedi are pretty perceptive. I've got a lot of bitterness stored up. It's not going to disappear overnight.
I know the Republic abandoned you before, but we're all on the same side now.
See? We can work together.
You're right. This doesn't come easy for me. A lot of hard feelings and bad memories.
You need the Republic, and they need you. Keep clinging to the past, and it'll only drag you down.
See? We can all play nice.
That's good advice. I can't promise things will change overnight--old habits are hard to break.
Don't mention it.
You can't spend gratitude.
I guess you deserve something for your efforts.
I'll be sure to tell everyone how the Republic stepped up when it counted. Good luck out there.
You got those scanners repaired yet?
Surprised to see a Jedi down here. Figured your type was always busy with bigger, more important things.
Well, well. The captain of Havoc Squad. If you're looking for the last of the Imps, you're in the right place.
You must be that Republic hire I've been hearing about. Some kind of special agent problem solver, right?
Fighting the Imps is bad enough, but dealing with Mandalorians too? I don't know how much more of this I can take.
I know things are tough, but you can't give up.
Hang in there.
I'm no quitter. I'm just tired. The resistance was battling the Empire long before you got here.
I'm tired of everyone on Balmorra moaning about how hard you've had it. Things are tough all over!
Quit whining.
Nobody had it as bad as us! When the Republic left Balmorra, the resistance kept fighting the Empire without any support!
Give me the details.
For years, we've given the Imperials all they could handle, and now they want payback-- only it's our families paying the price.
The Mandalorians disabled several of our long-range scanners. Without them, we have no warning of incoming Imperial attacks!
How badly are the scanners damaged?
Can they be repaired?
The problem isn't repairing them--it's getting past the Mandalorians.
Fighting the Mandalorians isn't like fighting the Imperials.
You're in over your head.
Tell me about it.
You don't need my help.
Easier said than done. We can handle the Imperials. But these Mandos are something else....
They're still camped out near the sensors. They ambush anyone who tries to repair them. I've lost two teams to them already.
Those long-range scanners are the only thing keeping us ahead of the Empire. They need to be fixed, Mandalorians or not.
The Mandos won't be a problem.
I guess I can help.
I appreciate it. I know I'm a little rough on you Republic types, but this is something the resistance just can't do.
Come back to me after you repair all the scanners. And watch out for the Mandos.
Forget it. [Refuse quest]
Figured as much. We'll figure out a way to handle this on our own... as usual.
I'm not in the mood to chat.
The Imps are doing more than enough damage on their own, but they went the extra mile and hired Mandalorian mercenaries too.
Rond Berrin, Balmorran resistance. Soon-to-be dead man too, if the Empire and their goons keep pounding us like this.
